1.text: A wise son [heareth] his father’s instruction; but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

2.text: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth; but the soul of the treacherous, violence.

3.text: He that guardeth his mouth keepeth his soul; destruction shall be to him that openeth wide his lips.

4.text: A sluggard’s soul desireth and hath nothing; but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

5.text: A righteous [man] hateth lying; but the wicked maketh himself odious and cometh to shame.

6.text: Righteousness preserveth him that is perfect in the way; but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

7.text: There is that feigneth himself rich, and hath nothing; there is that maketh himself poor, and hath great wealth.

8.text: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches; but the indigent heareth not rebuke.

9.text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth; but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

10.text: By pride there only cometh contention; but with the well-advised is wisdom.

11.text: Wealth [gotten] by vanity diminisheth; but he that gathereth by manual-labour shall increase [it].

12.text: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick; but the desire [that] cometh to pass is a tree of life.

13.text: Whoso despiseth the word shall be held by it; but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

14.text: The teaching of the wise [man] is a fountain of life, to turn away from the snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding procureth favour; but the way of the treacherous is hard.

16.text: Every prudent [man] acteth with knowledge; but the foolish layeth open [his] folly.

17.text: A wicked messenger falleth into evil; but a faithful ambassador is health.

18.text: Poverty and shame shall be [to] him that refuseth instruction; but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

19.text: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul; but it is abomination to the foolish to depart from evil.

20.text: He that walketh with wise [men] becometh wise; but a companion of the foolish will be depraved.

21.text: Evil pursueth sinners; but to the righteous good shall be repaid.

22.text: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children; but the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the righteous [man].

23.text: Much food is in the tillage of the poor; but there is that is lost for want of judgment.

24.text: He that spareth his rod hateth his son; but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

25.text: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul; but the belly of the wicked shall want.
